intro: Aeschynomene pseudoviscosa, commonly known as false velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and agricultural fields. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, pod-like fruits containing several seeds. Aeschynomene pseudoviscosa is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
